title: Comparative (Short Adjectives)
content: She is [taller|more tall] than her brother. Today is [hotter|more hot] than yesterday.
explanationEnUs: For one-syllable adjectives, add -er to form the comparative.
explanationZhTw: 對於單音節形容詞，加上 -er 構成比較級。
explanationZhCn: 对于单音节形容词，加上 -er 构成比较级。

title: Comparative (Long Adjectives)
content: This problem is [more difficult|difficulter] than the last one. She is [more famous|famouser] than him.
explanationEnUs: For adjectives with two or more syllables (mostly), use 'more' before the adjective.
explanationZhTw: 對於兩個或更多音節的形容詞（大多數），在形容詞前使用 'more'。
explanationZhCn: 对于两个 or 更多音节的形容词（大多数），在形容词前使用 'more'。

title: Superlative
content: It was the [happiest|most happy] day of my life. This is the [biggest|most big] cake I've ever seen.
explanationEnUs: Add -est (and change y to i) for short adjectives. Use 'the' before superlatives.
explanationZhTw: 短形容詞加 -est (y 變 i)。最高級前使用 'the'。
explanationZhCn: 短形容词加 -est (y 变 i)。最高级前使用 'the'。

title: Irregular Comparisons
content: This pizza is [better|gooder] than that one. That was the [worst|baddest] movie ever.
explanationEnUs: Good -> Better -> Best. Bad -> Worse -> Worst.
explanationZhTw: Good (好) -> Better (更好) -> Best (最好)。Bad (壞) -> Worse (更壞) -> Worst (最壞)。
explanationZhCn: Good (好) -> Better (更好) -> Best (最好)。Bad (坏) -> Worse (更坏) -> Worst (最坏)。
